Package frogger.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • frogger.model.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A Game will be created when the player starts a new game.
    See Also:
    SceneSwitch.switchToGame(GameMode, GameLevel, String nicknameA, String nicknameB)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(GameController gameController,
            GameMode gameMode,
            GameLevel gameLevel,
            javafx.scene.layout.Pane root)
        Constructs a new Game with the specified parameters and creates a new World of the game.
        Parameters:
        gameController - the GameController of the game view
        gameMode - the GameMode of the game
        gameLevel - the GameLevel of the game
        root - the Pane that is expected to be drawn

        Sets the nickname of players.
        Parameters:
        nicknameA - the nickname of the player A
        nicknameB - the nickname of the player B
        See Also:

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game.

      • endGame

        private void endGame()
        Ends the game and updates the prompt on the screen. If the game mode is DOUBLE, a scoreboard will be popped up.
        See Also:
        generatePrompt(), SceneSwitch.showScoreboard(String)

      • recordScore

        private void recordScore()
        Write the player's info to the scoreboard file.
        See Also:
        ScoreboardWriter

      • generatePrompt

        private java.lang.String generatePrompt()
        Generates the prompt according to the game mode and the score of two players.
        Returns:
        the prompt be generated

      • updateScore

        private void updateScore()
        Updates the score of players.
        See Also:
        GameController.updateScore(int, int)

      • updateLife

        private void updateLife()
        Updates the life of players.
        See Also:
        GameController.updateLife(int, int)

      • checkWin

        private boolean checkWin()
        Check if the player is win
        Returns:
        true if in single mode, the frog touches all ends, false otherwise

      • checkLose

        private boolean checkLose()
        Check if the player has lose all life.
        Returns:
        true if all players lose all life, false otherwise

      • isDoubleMode

        private boolean isDoubleMode()
